submission_terms.title: Submit a post
submission_terms.guidelines:
What’s a perfect image for ART RUBY?

We’re a very visual website and we’re seeking for imagery that begs to be clicked on. Ideally, it’s colorful, beautiful, and something that you automatically want to explore. But here are few other guidelines.

The perfect image…
1. Easily describes the event, artist, or artwork
2. Is vivid in color and good contrast unless it’s meant to be otherwise.
3. Is not grainy or blurry.
4. Is text and graphic element free unless it’s a book cover. That goes for borders, text, and watermarks.
5. Don't forget to add a caption.

blog.name: mdme-x

submission_terms.title: submit
submission_terms.guidelines:
Please keep it to contemporary art/artists that I can source and give due credit. (full name, if they have a tumblr, or a website).

Works must be submitted INDIVIDUALLY, and each must include
the TITLE (if they have one),
the DATE completed,
the MEDIUM (materials ex.oil paint on canvas)
the SIZE (Width x Height format, in. or cm.)
*include Depth, W x H x D for sculptural pieces of if any parts of the work protrude outwards and must be crated individually)
Also,
Please include any original photos of signatures, dates, edition numbers, appraisals, provenance information, edition size and number of AP's, along with a note if this is part of an ongoing series or a series you are submitting individually -so i can keep them together.

please note: posting on my blog, mdme-x, is generally just a boost for artists to generate interest and buzz about their work. it is curated by me, and i will not choose any or every work. if you are chosen, or like a piece you are interested in buying or want to sell seperately on my gallernet (or contact me about any services provided there) please email nicole@mdme-x.com or info@mdme-x.com. Please include name and info accompanying your submissions.

Thank you!!!!!!!!

blog.description: Join Our Fb Group. The Photographers Directory aims to project photographers on tumblr on to the global stage, by recognizing and showcasing their original creative work.
blog.name: photographersdirectory

submission_terms.title: Submit a post
submission_terms.guidelines:
Welcome to the submission page. Before submitting your tumblr, please carefully read the following guidelines.

PLEASE NOTE: Submissions not following the guidelines below will be rejected without further notice.

You are allowed to submit a photography tumblr blog that showcases original, quality art work. A blog consisting mainly of reblogs will not be accepted; don’t take it personally, we are simply putting a strong emphasis on showcasing artists and their personal work. In order for your submission to be accepted, you must show at least a couple of pages of original photos.

Only one submission per tumblr is allowed.

Each entry in the Photographers Directory consists in a photo and a caption describing the photographer's profile. In order to submit your photography tumblr please follow these steps: 1. Choose and load a photo which you think best represents your work or your style. 2. Fill the caption with information about you and your work. You can include details on your photography gear, medium and your vision on photography. Include links to your tumblr, portfolio, flickr, twitter, etc. Submissions with an empty description field will be rejected. Subsequent requests to edit the description field to add missing info, links, etc. will be ignored, so take some time to make sure that everything is there. 3. Set the click-through link to your own photography tumblr. 4. Choose tags from the tag list describing your photography style. Don't just tick all the tags, try to stick to the four-five tags better describing the majority of the photographs in your photography tumblr. 5. Submit! Your submission will be checked and put into the publishing queue if it satisfies all submission requirements. Depending on the amount of submissions it might take a few days for your entry to be published. Thank you for joining the Photographers Directory project, and don't forget to spread the word!

Please only press the submit button once, clicking it multiple times means we get many copies of your submission.

blog.title: The Photographers Directory

blog.description:
This is the official Tumblr of  the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. We post all sorts of museum-related goodness, plus submissions of artwork from you, our talented and magnificent followers, on Fridays. 
In the mood for a meatier read? Check out...
blog.name: sfmoma

submission_terms.title: SUBMIT
submission_terms.guidelines:
Every Friday we post a selection of the original artwork that is submitted to our Tumblr by you, our online community. To see all of the submissions that we've posted so far, go here.

Guidelines for submitting to SFMOMA's Tumblr:

• Submissions must be original artwork and the submitting artist must hold all rights to the work.
• Photographers must have explicit permission from any people whose faces are recognizable in their photographs.
• By submitting to SFMOMA’s Tumblr, the artist or, if the artist is under the age of 18, the artist’s parent or guardian, grants to SFMOMA the right to use and publish the artist’s submitted work for any purpose and in any media, in perpetuity, without compensation. The artist or, if the artist is under the age of 18, the artist’s parent or guardian, also grants to SFMOMA the right to crop the submitted work, and to use the artist’s name in association with his/her submitted work.
• Artists retain copyright in their submitted work, subject to the rights granted above.
• Due to a high volume of submissions, only select submitted works will be published to SFMOMA’s Tumblr.

How to submit:

• We prefer that you submit your work as a photo or video post.
• Alternatively, you may submit your work as a direct link to a post on your personal Tumblr blog. Example: http://sfmoma.tumblr.com/post/28359537469/danachang-basically-art-nerds-fo-life
• We recommend using Google Chrome or Firefox to send in your submission.
• In the caption, please include your name, artwork title, and any other information about the piece that you'd like included in the post!

blog.title: SFMOMA

blog.name: spraybeast

blog.description:
Staged Photography is a celebration of images that were made consciously. This blog is about photographic art that was created on purpose, not simple snap-shots that were stumbled upon.

Photographic artists make specific choices when staging their images. Beyond the unique eye that captures a given situation, these artists create the events, the environments or the emotion.

This art form lives beyond the typical genres of photography. This site is NOT about landscape images, the clever shot found within the journalistic disciplines of street & people photography, nor is it about abstract imagery, although each genre certainly has its masters.

This blog celebrates the image makers. The staged and constructed image is so much more compelling than a serendipitous one. There are many shooters who have a good eye. They can take a mundane moment and capture it in a powerful way… But an image that was created, that had its elements consciously placed and its composition arranged… That’s painting with light.
blog.name: staged-photography

submission_terms.title: Submit a post
submission_terms.guidelines:
Feel free to submit... but please remember: this is about Fine Art Staged Photography. There have been waaay too many submissions that would find a better audience on Flickr or Model Mayhem.

If the work is not your own, please attempt to provide attribution... the name of the artist, the name of the piece, the name of the series (if possible) and the year it was created. Also, include the representing gallery if you know it.

blog.title: Staged Photography
